intro: Rabelera, commonly known as the Brazilian jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers are often used in perfumes and traditional medicine due to their aromatic properties. Rabelera thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
